title: County of Sacramento, Department of Revenue Recovery trying to collect long past-due debts for court fees.Are these time-barred?
question: Good afternoon,
answers:
If the Department of Revenue Recovery (DRR) is a division or agency or department of the County of Sacramento, then the DRR is not a collection agency or 3rd party collector. If the DRR is simply a name that a private company that collects government debt and the name was chosen to look official, then the DRR is a 3rd party collector.

You need to contact a local attorney that handles bankruptcy and collection matters. Use the Avvo "Find a Lawyer" link at the top of this page to start your search.
If the letter stated that it was sent to a collection agency then your credit can be adversely affected.

Maybe. California statute of limitations for collecting a debt varies depending on type of debt, creditor, intervening actions. Summary of statutes relating to various types of debt follow:
-Oral Contract: 2 years;
-Written Contract: 4 years;
-Promissory Note: 4 years;
-Open-Ended Accounts: 4 years
If no intervening actions undertaken to toll SOL, the debt is time barred.
